channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Spatio-temporal collaborative multiple-stream transformer network for liver lesion classification on multiple-sequence magnetic resonance imaging
item.description: Accurate identification of focal liver lesions is essential for determining the appropriate therapeutic approach in clinical practice.

item.title: Comparative Study of Machine Unlearning Techniques for Computer Vision and NLP Models
item.description: Machine unlearning is an emerging field in machine learning that focuses on efficiently removing the influence of specific data from a trained model.

item.title: Evaluating the Performance of TAAF for image classification models
item.description: In this paper, we present the results of testing a custom activation function, The Analog Activation Function (TAAF), on both the MNIST and CIFAR-10 datasets.

item.title: Redistribute Ensemble Training for Mitigating Memorization in Diffusion Models
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel method for diffusion models from the perspective of visual modality, which is more generic and fundamental for mitigating memorization.

item.title: Unlocking the Potential of Classic GNNs for Graph-level Tasks: Simple Architectures Meet Excellence
item.description: Message-passing Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) are often criticized for their limited expressiveness, issues like over-smoothing and over-squashing, and challenges in capturing long-range dependencies, while Graph Transformers (GTs) are considered superior due to their global attention mechanisms.

item.title: Eidetic Learning: an Efficient and Provable Solution to Catastrophic Forgetting
item.description: We show with a variety of network architectures and sets of tasks that EideticNets are immune to forgetting.

item.title: The Stochastic Parrot on LLM's Shoulder: A Summative Assessment of Physical Concept Understanding
item.description: In a systematic way, we investigate a widely asked question: Do LLMs really understand what they say?, which relates to the more familiar term Stochastic Parrot.

item.title: AnomalyGFM: Graph Foundation Model for Zero/Few-shot Anomaly Detection
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose AnomalyGFM, a GAD-oriented graph foundation model that supports zero-shot inference and few-shot prompt tuning for GAD in diverse graph datasets.

item.title: Top-Theta Attention: Sparsifying Transformers by Compensated Thresholding
item.description: The attention mechanism is essential for the impressive capabilities of transformer-based Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: Uncertainty Aware Human-machine Collaboration in Camouflaged Object Detection
item.description: Camouflaged Object Detection (COD), the task of identifying objects concealed within their environments, has seen rapid growth due to its wide range of practical applications.

item.title: ViLa-MIL: Dual-scale Vision-Language Multiple Instance Learning for Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: Specifically, we propose a dual-scale visual descriptive text prompt based on the frozen large language model (LLM) to boost the performance of VLM effectively.

item.title: Composite Sketch+Text Queries for Retrieving Objects with Elusive Names and Complex Interactions
item.description: Further, as a solution to this problem, we propose a pretrained multimodal transformer-based baseline, STNET (Sketch+Text Network), that uses a hand-drawn sketch to localize relevant objects in the natural scene image, and encodes the text and image to perform image retrieval.

item.title: Brain Latent Progression: Individual-based Spatiotemporal Disease Progression on 3D Brain MRIs via Latent Diffusion
item.description: The key contributions in BrLP are fourfold: (i) it operates in a small latent space, mitigating the computational challenges posed by high-dimensional imaging data; (ii) it explicitly integrates subject metadata to enhance the individualization of predictions; (iii) it incorporates prior knowledge of disease dynamics through an auxiliary model, facilitating the integration of longitudinal data; and (iv) it introduces the Latent Average Stabilization (LAS) algorithm, which (a) enforces spatiotemporal consistency in the predicted progression at inference time and (b) allows us to derive a measure of the uncertainty for the prediction.

item.title: Color Universal Design Neural Network for the Color Vision Deficiencies
item.description: To generate CUD images for color deficiencies, we follow a four-step process.

item.title: Loss Landscape Analysis for Reliable Quantized ML Models for Scientific Sensing
item.description: In this paper, we propose a method to perform empirical analysis of the loss landscape of machine learning (ML) models.

item.title: Light-A-Video: Training-free Video Relighting via Progressive Light Fusion
item.description: Second, leveraging the physical principle of light transport independence, we apply linear blending between the source video's appearance and the relighted appearance, using a Progressive Light Fusion (PLF) strategy to ensure smooth temporal transitions in illumination.

item.title: Uniform Kernel Prober
item.description: In this work, we develop a class of pseudometrics called Uniform Kernel Prober (UKP) for comparing features or representations learned by different statistical models such as neural networks when the downstream prediction tasks involve kernel ridge regression.

item.title: New tools for comparing classical and neural ODE models for tumor growth
item.description: A new computational tool TumorGrowth. jl for modeling tumor growth is introduced.

item.title: Grammar Control in Dialogue Response Generation for Language Learning Chatbots
item.description: However, they are hard to control for linguistic forms that correspond to learners' current needs, such as grammar.

item.title: Forget What You Know about LLMs Evaluations - LLMs are Like a Chameleon
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) often appear to excel on public benchmarks, but these high scores may mask an overreliance on dataset-specific surface cues rather than true language understanding.

item.title: Distributional Instrumental Variable Method
item.description: Our empirical results show that the DIV method performs well for a broad range of simulated data, exhibiting advantages over existing IV approaches in terms of the identifiability and estimation error of the mean or quantile treatment effects.

item.title: Semi-Supervised Vision-Centric 3D Occupancy World Model for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Considering the high annotation cost for 3D outdoor scenes, we propose a semi-supervised vision-centric 3D occupancy world model, PreWorld, to leverage the potential of 2D labels through a novel two-stage training paradigm: the self-supervised pre-training stage and the fully-supervised fine-tuning stage.

item.title: Towards a Robust Framework for Multimodal Hate Detection: A Study on Video vs. Image-based Content
item.description: This paper presents a systematic analysis of fusion-based approaches for multimodal hate detection, focusing on their performance across video and image-based content.

item.title: Heterogeneity in Sectoral Production and the Macro Effect of Sectoral Shocks
item.description: The effect of a negative sectoral shock on GDP depends on how important the shocked sector is as a direct and indirect supplier and how easily sectors can substitute inputs.

item.title: FinRL-DeepSeek: LLM-Infused Risk-Sensitive Reinforcement Learning for Trading Agents
item.description: This paper presents a novel risk-sensitive trading agent combining reinforcement learning and large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Automated Capability Discovery via Model Self-Exploration
item.description: We introduce Automated Capability Discovery (ACD), a framework that designates one foundation model as a scientist to systematically propose open-ended tasks probing the abilities of a subject model (potentially itself).

item.title: EIQP: Execution-time-certified and Infeasibility-detecting QP Solver
item.description: Solving real-time quadratic programming (QP) is a ubiquitous task in control engineering, such as in model predictive control and control barrier function-based QP.

item.title: Graph RAG-Tool Fusion
item.description: In this paper, we address this limitation by introducing Graph RAG-Tool Fusion, a novel plug-and-play approach that combines the strengths of vector-based retrieval with efficient graph traversal to capture all relevant tools (nodes) along with any nested dependencies (edges) within the predefined tool knowledge graph.

item.title: DPO-Shift: Shifting the Distribution of Direct Preference Optimization
item.description: Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) and its variants have become increasingly popular for aligning language models with human preferences.

item.title: RusCode: Russian Cultural Code Benchmark for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: The lack of cultural awareness can reduce the generation quality and lead to undesirable consequences such as unintentional insult, and the spread of prejudice.

item.title: LASP-2: Rethinking Sequence Parallelism for Linear Attention and Its Hybrid
item.description: In this paper, we introduce LASP-2, a new SP method to enhance both communication and computation parallelism when training linear attention transformer models with very-long input sequences.

item.title: JamendoMaxCaps: A Large Scale Music-caption Dataset with Imputed Metadata
item.description: We introduce JamendoMaxCaps, a large-scale music-caption dataset featuring over 200, 000 freely licensed instrumental tracks from the renowned Jamendo platform.

item.title: An Elliptic Curve Based Solution to the Perspective-Three-Point Problem
item.description: The Perspective-Three-Point Problem (P3P) is solved by first focusing on determining the directions of the lines through pairs of control points, relative to the camera, rather than the distances from the camera to the control points.

item.title: Auditing Prompt Caching in Language Model APIs
item.description: We detect global cache sharing across users in seven API providers, including OpenAI, resulting in potential privacy leakage about users' prompts.

item.title: Evolution of cooperation in a bimodal mixture of conditional cooperators
item.description: To explore the effects of hard and soft conditional cooperators, we examine their interactions in two scenarios: structural mixture (SM) and probabilistic mixture (PM), where the two behavioral modes are fixed and probabilistically adopted, respectively.

item.title: A Large-Scale Benchmark for Vietnamese Sentence Paraphrases
item.description: This paper presents ViSP, a high-quality Vietnamese dataset for sentence paraphrasing, consisting of 1. 2M original-paraphrase pairs collected from various domains.

item.title: Partial-Label Learning with Conformal Candidate Cleaning
item.description: To work around the missing labeled validation set, which is typically required for conformal prediction, we propose a strategy that alternates between training a PLL classifier to label the validation set, leveraging these predicted class labels for calibration, and pruning candidate labels that are not part of the resulting conformal sets.

item.title: Provably Efficient RLHF Pipeline: A Unified View from Contextual Bandits
item.description: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) is a widely used approach for aligning Large Language Models (LLMs) with human preferences.

item.title: Integrating Physics and Data-Driven Approaches: An Explainable and Uncertainty-Aware Hybrid Model for Wind Turbine Power Prediction
item.description: In this study, we propose a hybrid semi-parametric model that combines the strengths of both approaches, applied to a dataset from a wind farm with four turbines.

item.title: BenchMAX: A Comprehensive Multilingual Evaluation Suite for Large Language Models
item.description: Previous multilingual benchmarks focus primarily on simple understanding tasks, but for large language models(LLMs), we emphasize proficiency in instruction following, reasoning, long context understanding, code generation, and so on.

item.title: Small Language Model Makes an Effective Long Text Extractor
item.description: However, the task of extracting longer entity spans (e. g., awards) from extended texts (e. g., homepages) is barely explored.

item.title: Target-Augmented Shared Fusion-based Multimodal Sarcasm Explanation Generation
item.description: TURBO assumes the target of the sarcasm and guides the multimodal shared fusion mechanism in learning intricacies of the intended irony for explanations.

item.title: Aligning Large Language Models to Follow Instructions and Hallucinate Less via Effective Data Filtering
item.description: By considering data quality and avoiding unfamiliar data, we can utilize the selected data to effectively align LLMs to follow instructions and hallucinate less.

item.title: Goedel-Prover: A Frontier Model for Open-Source Automated Theorem Proving
item.description: On the miniF2F benchmark, it achieves a 57. 6% success rate (Pass@32), exceeding the previous best open-source model by 7. 6%.

item.title: The Devil is in the Prompts: De-Identification Traces Enhance Memorization Risks in Synthetic Chest X-Ray Generation
item.description: Synthetic chest X-ray generation is one of the most common applications in medical image analysis with the MIMIC-CXR dataset serving as the primary data repository for this task.

item.title: Training Sparse Mixture Of Experts Text Embedding Models
item.description: Transformer-based text embedding models have improved their performance on benchmarks like MIRACL and BEIR by increasing their parameter counts.

item.title: Hallucination, Monofacts, and Miscalibration: An Empirical Investigation
item.description: Recent theoretical work by [Kalai and Vempala 2024] proves that a particular notion of hallucination rate in LLMs must be lower bounded by the training data monofact rate (related to the classical Good-Turing missing mass estimator) minus model miscalibration.

item.title: CodeI/O: Condensing Reasoning Patterns via Code Input-Output Prediction
item.description: Reasoning is a fundamental capability of Large Language Models.

item.title: SketchFlex: Facilitating Spatial-Semantic Coherence in Text-to-Image Generation with Region-Based Sketches
item.description: Text-to-image models can generate visually appealing images from text descriptions.

item.title: CreAgent: Towards Long-Term Evaluation of Recommender System under Platform-Creator Information Asymmetry
item.description: While previous studies have attempted to model creator behavior, they often overlook the role of information asymmetry.
